page.title: 04 FARMING AROUND FORDYCE
page.content:
- GENERAL -
There are 13 farms ranging from 60 to 80 hectares. Most of the buildings date from the end of the 19th Century, and most are Mixed Farms. The main crop is Barley,although Oil Seed Rape is common,and much of the ground is used for grazing. Oats and Wheat are also grown, with Potatoes and Turnips the main vegetables. Crops are usually well watered by plentiful rainfall,but water for animals is obtained from springs on Knock Hill,Durn Hill and other uplands. Some farmers have as many as 175 cattle,others as many as 350 sheep,for breeding or rearing and selling to market. There is only l piggery which has recently changed hands. All farms have very modern machinery. Much of the land is still leased from Seafield Estates.
